reasoning: LAM is extremely rare, affecting primarily women of reproductive age. Incidence ~0.1 per 100k (new diagnoses), prevalence ~0.3 per 100k based on registry studies.
source: Harknett EC et al. (2011). Use of variability in national and regional data to estimate the prevalence of lymphangioleiomyomatosis. QJM. 104(11):971-979
